intro: Bartsia urticoides, commonly known as the stinging nettle bartsia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its hairy, often glandular stems and leaves, which can cause skin irritation upon contact. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Bartsia urticoides thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows.
